hanzi-su-wiki:
領

Значения

Владение, территория; власть, господство; руководитель, глава; звание (воинское)

Мнемоника

Глава 頁 территории с правом отдавать приказы 令.

Варианты

领
purpleculture_pinyin:
lǐng
neck; collar; to lead; to receive; classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
шея; воротник; вести; получать; классификатор для одежды, коврики, ширмы и т. д.

heisig_chinese_memo: Two cowboys are crossing a state limit. One says to him “Did you know that in this Jurisdiction there are Orders to get your head, and bring your collar for proof?”, so he takes out his gun and shoots him. He claims the reward afterwards.
heisig_constituent: jurisdiction, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: Two cowboys are crossing a state limit. One says to him “Did you know that in this Jurisdiction there are Orders to get your head?”, so he takes out his gun and shoots him. He claims the reward afterwards. (Thanks Fuaburisu).
koohiiStory2: Orders are given by the head person in any jurisdiction.
jp_example_words:
占領(せんりょう): occupation, capture, possession, have a room to oneself
領域(りょういき): area, domain, territory, field, region, regime
領海(りょうかい): territorial waters
領地(りょうち): territory, dominion
領土(りょうど): dominion, territory, possession
大統領(だいとうりょう): president, chief executive
要領(ようりょう): point, gist, essentials, outline
領事(りょうじ): consul
領収(りょうしゅう): receipt, voucher
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Taking orders from a geoduck will place you into enemy territory. Geoducks make terrible commanders, so if you take orders from one, expect to end up in unknown territory, potentially even enemy territory. Be prepared.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this geoduck shouting orders at you to march into enemy territory. See its gross body as a mouth forms and starts shouting out orders.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Not wanting to end up dead in enemy territory, you decide to escape this geoduck leader by getting on a row (りょう) boat and rowing your way outta there. The geoduck commander orders you to halt your escape, but you still get in your row boat and row away.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel yourself in the row boat as you imagine rowing away to safe territory. Hear the geoduck in the background shouting at you from shore, ordering you to return to land.

Ru_trainchinese:

lǐng: (сущ) ворот, воротник, воротничок
lǐng: (графема/сч.слово) шея; главное, суть; обладать, занимать; понимать; счетное слово для халатов и циновок
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the page (頁) gives the orders (令) because he has jurisdiction
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The head of the church wears a special collar and gives all the orders.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " page ", " ling " sound, the original meaning is neck. "Shuowen": "Xiang Ye. From the page, to make the sound." "Poetry·Weifeng·Suoren": "The collar is like a grub, and the teeth are like a rhinoceros." Mao Chuan: "The collar, the neck."

" Collar " can mean a collar. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "If you turn on a fur collar, you can stop it with five fingers, and you will be countless."

" Lead " can also mean command and control. "The Book of Han·Wei Xiang Chuan": "Emperor Xuan was first prosperous, rigorously governed, trained the ministers, verified the name, and the chief of the Xiang commanded all the positions, which is very good.

" Lead " can also mean governance. "The Book of Rites‧The Book of Music": "The Festival of Leading Fathers and Sons, Monarchs and Ministers." Zheng Xuan's Note: "Leading, you can still govern."

" Lead " also means essentials. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Preface": "Part 1 and above, the program is clear."

" Lead " also means to understand and appreciate. Jin Taoqian's "Drinking" No. 13: "Wake up drunk and laugh at each other, but I don't receive any speech."

" Lead " also refers to leading and guiding. Tang Hanyu's "Li Hua" Part 2: "The night leader Zhang Che casts Lu Tong, and rides the clouds to the Jade Royal Palace."

Acceptance and receipt are also expressed as " collateral ". Tang Dufu "Knitted into a mattress from the legacy of the Prince Zhang Sheren": "Lead the guest to cherish the meaning, and take care that I am not a public servant."
humanum_short_description_en: From " page ", " ling " sound, the original meaning is neck.
humanum_full_description:
從「頁」，「令」聲，本義為脖子。《說文》：「項也。从頁，令聲。」 《詩‧衛風‧碩人》：「領如蝤蠐，齒如瓠犀。」毛傳：「領，頸也。」

　　「領」可表示衣領。《荀子‧勸學》：「若挈裘領，詘五指而頓之，順者不可勝數也。」

　　「領」也可表示統率、管領。《漢書‧魏相傳》：「宣帝始親萬機，厲精為治，練群臣，核名實，而相總領眾職，甚稱上意。」

　　「領」還可表示治理。《禮記‧樂記》：「領父子君臣之節。」鄭玄注：「領，猶理治也。」

　　「領」亦表示要領。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧序志》：「上篇以上，綱領明矣。」

　　「領」還指領會、領略。晉陶潛〈飲酒〉之十三：「醒醉還相笑，發言各不領。」

　　「領」也指帶領、引導。唐韓愈〈李花〉之二：「夜領張徹投盧仝，乘雲共至玉皇家。」

　　接受、領取也用「領」表示。唐杜甫〈太子張舍人遺織成褥段〉：「領客珍重意，顧我非公卿。」

ling3
HSK 5: 领,令,領
領領RS
领领 		neck, collar, lead, guide
  • commanding 令 part of the head 頁: a straight neck
(Simplified: 领)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 發
Pictophonetic: 令 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 令 [ lìng ] command, decree, order; magistrate; to allow, to cause
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①頸，脖子：引領而望。
②衣服上圍繞脖子的部分：衣領。領口。領結。領帶。領章。
③事物的綱要：領袖。要領。提綱挈領。
④帶，引，率(shuài)：帶領。率(shuài)領。領頭。領銜。
⑤治理的，管轄的：領海。領空。領土。領域。佔領。
⑥接受，取得：領獎。領命。領款。領教(jiào)。招領。
⑦瞭解，明白：領悟。領略。心領神會。
⑧量詞，用於衣服、席、箔等：一領席。
⑨古同“嶺”，山嶺。
領導 [ lǐng dǎo ]: lead; leading; to lead; leadership; leader; Classifiers: 位
領域 [ lǐng yù ]: domain; sphere; field; territory; area

Lesson: 37 frameNoV4: 1405 frameNoV6: 1507 Strokes: 14 Jouyou Grade: 5 JLPT: 2
占領(せんりょう): occupation, capture, possession, have a room to oneself
領域(りょういき): area, domain, territory, field, region, regime
領海(りょうかい): territorial waters
領地(りょうち): territory, dominion
領土(りょうど): dominion, territory, possession
大統領(だいとうりょう): president, chief executive
要領(ようりょう): point, gist, essentials, outline
領事(りょうじ): consul
領収(りょうしゅう): receipt, voucher

從「 頁 」，「 令 」聲，本義為脖子。《說文》：「項也。从頁，令聲。」 《詩‧衛風‧碩人》：「領如蝤蠐，齒如瓠犀。」毛傳：「領，頸也。」 「 領 」可表示衣領。《荀子‧勸學》：「若挈裘領，詘五指而頓之，順者不可勝數也。」 「 領 」也可表示統率、管領。《漢書‧魏相傳》：「宣帝始親萬機，厲精為治，練群臣，核名實，而相總領眾職，甚稱上意。」 「 領 」還可表示治理。《禮記‧樂記》：「領父子君臣之節。」鄭玄注：「領，猶理治也。」 「 領 」亦表示要領。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧序志》：「上篇以上，綱領明矣。」 「 領 」還指領會、領略。晉陶潛〈飲酒〉之十三：「醒醉還相笑，發言各不領。」 「 領 」也指帶領、引導。唐韓愈〈李花〉之二：「夜領張徹投盧仝，乘雲共至玉皇家。」 接受、領取也用「 領 」表示。唐杜甫〈太子張舍人遺織成褥段〉：「領客珍重意，顧我非公卿。」
From " page", " ling" sound, the original meaning is neck. "Shuowen": "Xiang Ye. From the page, to make the sound." "Poetry·Weifeng·Suoren": "The collar is like a grub, and the teeth are like a rhinoceros." Mao Chuan: "The collar, the neck." " Collar" can mean a collar. "Xunzi: Encouraging Learning": "If you turn on a fur collar, you can stop it with five fingers, and you will be countless." " Lead" can also mean command and control. "The Book of Han·Wei Xiang Chuan": "Emperor Xuan was first prosperous, rigorously governed, trained the ministers, verified the name, and the chief of the Xiang commanded all the positions, which is very good. " Lead" can also mean governance. "The Book of Rites‧The Book of Music": "The Festival of Leading Fathers and Sons, Monarchs and Ministers." Zheng Xuan's Note: "Leading, you can still govern." " Lead" also means essentials. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Preface": "Part 1 and above, the program is clear." " Lead" also means to understand and appreciate. Jin Taoqian's "Drinking" No. 13: "Wake up drunk and laugh at each other, but I don't receive any speech." " Lead" also refers to leading and guiding. Tang Hanyu's "Li Hua" Part 2: "The night leader Zhang Che casts Lu Tong, and rides the clouds to the Jade Royal Palace." Acceptance and receipt are also expressed as " collateral". Tang Dufu "Knitted into a mattress from the legacy of the Prince Zhang Sheren": "Lead the guest to cherish the meaning, and take care that I am not a public servant."

領字的基本解释

領
lǐng
见“领”。

領字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǐng］
［《廣韻》良郢切，上静，來。］
“领1”的繁体字。
(1)脖子。
(2)衣领。
(3)指被子的被头。
(4)要领。
(5)治理。
(6)统率；管领。
(7)引申为提挈。
(8)汉代以后，以地位较高的官员兼理较低的职务，谓之“領”。也称“録”。
(9)带领；引导。
(10)接受；领取。
(11)领会；领略。
(12)记录。
(13)量词。用于衣服、铠甲。
(14)量词。用于床上用具。
(15)“嶺”的古字。山岭。
(16)“嶺”的古字。指轘辕山。
(17)“嶺”的古字。指五岭。参见“領外”、“領表”。
(18)通“令”。善，美好。参见“領聞”。

領字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　領； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1402第23
【唐韻】良郢切【集韻】【正韻】里郢切【韻會】里整切，?音嶺。【說文】項也。从頁令聲。【釋名】領，頸也。以壅頸也。亦言總領衣體，爲端首也。【詩·小雅】交交桑扈，有鶯其領。【傳】鶯鶯然有文章也。領，頸也。【荀子·勸學篇】若挈裘領。　又【廣韻】理也。【韻會】方氏曰：承上令下謂之領。【禮·祭義】先王之敎因而弗改，所以領天下國家也。又【樂記】領父子君臣之節。【註】領，猶理治也。又【仲尼燕居】言游進曰：敢問禮也者，領惡而全好者歟。【註】領，猶治也。　又【韻會】統領也。【前漢·魏相傳】總領庶職。　又【廣韻】錄也。【劉公幹詩】沈速簿領書。【註】領，錄也。　又楚官名。【左傳·昭二十七年】鄢將師爲右領。　又晉官名。【晉書·職官志】中領軍將軍，魏官也。　又地名。【左傳·昭二十二年】樊頃子奉王以追單子及領。【註】領，周地。【前漢·王子侯表】蒲領侯嘉。　又山道，與嶺通。【前漢·嚴助傳】輿轎而踰領。　又【正字通】受也。　又叶離貞切，音鄰。【韓愈·田氏廟?】嶪嶪魏土，嬰兒弄

小篆楷体

collar
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lǐng］
["Guangyun" Liangying cut, Shangjing, come. ]
Traditional characters for "领1".
(1) Neck.
(2) Collar.
(3) Refers to the quilt of the quilt.
(4) Essentials.
(5) Governance.
(6) Command; control and lead.
(7) It is extended to mention Xu.
(8) After the Han dynasty, officials with higher status concurrently took charge of lower positions, which was called "leading". Also called "record".
(9) Lead; guide.
(10) Accept; receive.
(11) Comprehend; appreciate.
(12) Record.
(13) Quantifiers. Used for clothes and armor.
(14) Quantifiers. Used for bed utensils.
(15) The ancient character of "Ling". Mountains.
(16) The ancient character of "Ling". Refers to Zhuyuan Mountain.
(17) The ancient word for "Ling". Refers to Wuling. See "Outside the Territory", "Leading Watch".
(18) Pass "Order". Good, beautiful. See also "information".
collar

Name meaning

lǐng
вм. 领
Radicals: 令, 頁  (orders, geoduck)
Meaning Mnemonic
Taking orders from a geoduck will place you into enemy territory. Geoducks make terrible commanders, so if you take orders from one, expect to end up in unknown territory, potentially even enemy territory. Be prepared.
Imagine this geoduck shouting orders at you to march into enemy territory. See its gross body as a mouth forms and starts shouting out orders.
Reading Mnemonic
Not wanting to end up dead in enemy territory, you decide to escape this geoduck leader by getting on a row (りょう) boat and rowing your way outta there. The geoduck commander orders you to halt your escape, but you still get in your row boat and row away.
Feel yourself in the row boat as you imagine rowing away to safe territory. Hear the geoduck in the background shouting at you from shore, ordering you to return to land.
